sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"委员会"之意。
means: committee ： 既用作普通名词，也用作集体名词，指通过选举或其它方式而成立的一般委员会。
commission ： 指为了某项任务专门成立的委员会。

sentence.Network_en: Just a few days ago, I finished a commission.
sentence.Network_cn: 就在几天前，我完成了一项委托创作任务。

sentence.Network_en: This commission would keep environmental scorecards on UN member nations.
sentence.Network_cn: 该委员会将对联合国的成员国采用环境记录卡制。

sentence.Network_en: If the Commission has its way, the entire deal will be scuppered.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果委员会我行我素的话，整个交易将化为泡影。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 常见银行英语词汇 ... broker 经纪人 commission 佣金 bookkeeping 簿记.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... missionary a 传道的 commission n 委员会；委任 dismiss v 解散；罢免.
沙巴-亚庇攻略 - 蚂蜂窝 ... 旅行支票： Traveler's check 手续费： Commission 入境大厅： Arrival Lobby.
大英语B级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... commercial adj. 商业的,贸易的 commission n. 委任,委托 commit vt. 做,犯(错误),处理,保证.

list.abs: 翻译中的一些常用词汇等 ... 旧货店 second-hand goods store 寄卖商店 commission shop 综合修理店 general repair shop.
会计词汇E ... commission 佣金；委员会 commission house 佣金行；代办行 commission payable 须付的佣金.
外贸英语词汇英汉全对照 [南方网教育频道] ... 港口税 port dues 回佣 return commission 装运港 port of shipment.

jx.jx_en_mean: In active service. Used of a ship.
In use or in usable condition.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在使用中或在使用条件中

jx.jx_en_mean: With a sales commission serving as full or partial recompense for the work done
jx.jx_cn_mean: 委托：具有用于对所作工作全部或部分酬金的销售委托

jx.jx_en_mean: Not in active service. Used of a ship.
Not in use or in working condition.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin commissio(n-), from committere 'entrust' (see commit)

entry.def: If you commission something or commission someone to do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you.

example.ex: The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming...
example.tran: 农业部委托对低投入耕作进行研究。

example.ex: You can commission them to paint something especially for you.
example.tran: 你可以委托他们专门为你画点什么。

entry.tran: 受托之事;(接受报酬的)任务
entry.def: A commission is a piece of work that someone is asked to do and is paid for.

example.ex: Just a few days ago, I finished a commission.
example.tran: 就在几天前，我完成了一项委托创作任务。

entry.def: Commission is a sum of money paid to a salesperson for every sale that he or she makes. If a salesperson is paid on commission, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell.

example.ex: The salesmen work on commission only...
example.tran: 销售人员只根据销售量提取佣金。

example.ex: He also got a commission for bringing in new clients.
example.tran: 他还因为带来了很多新客户拿到一笔佣金。

entry.tran: (银行或公司收取的)服务费，手续费
entry.def: If a bank or other company charges commission, they charge a fee for providing a service, for example for exchanging money or issuing an insurance policy.

example.ex: Travel agents charge 1 per cent commission on sterling cheques...
example.tran: 旅行社对英镑支票收取1%的服务费。

example.ex: Sellers pay a fixed commission fee.
example.tran: 卖方支付固定的服务费。

entry.def: A commission is a group of people who have been appointed to find out about something or to control something.

example.ex: The authorities have been asked to set up a commission to investigate the murders.
example.tran: 当局被敦促成立一个委员会负责调查这些谋杀案。

entry.def: The commission of a crime is the act of committing a crime.

example.ex: If a person uses a gun in the commission of a crime, then he should be given an additional penalty.
example.tran: 如果使用枪支进行犯罪，就应该受到额外的惩罚。

entry.def: If a member of the armed forces receives a commission, he or she becomes an officer.

example.ex: He accepted a commission as a naval officer.
example.tran: 他接受任命成为一名海军军官。

entry.def: If a member of the armed forces is commissioned, he or she is made an officer.

example.ex: He was commissioned as second lieutenant in the Air Force...
Only commissioned officers qualify for the Military Cross.
example.tran: 只有持委任状的军官才有资格获得十字勋章。

entry.tran: (船、设备等)坏了的，不能使用的
entry.def: If something, for example a ship or a piece of equipment, is out of commission, it is broken and cannot be used until it is repaired.

example.ex: The operator expects the ship to be out of commission until the end of September.
example.tran: 技工预计这艘船到9月底才能修好。

means.word_mean: 1. a special group delegated to consider some matter;

sentences.sentence: "a committee is a group that keeps minutes and loses hours" - Milton Berle

means.word_mean: 2. a fee for services rendered based on a percentage of an amount received or collected or agreed to be paid (as distinguished from a salary);
3. the act of granting authority to undertake certain functions
4. the state of being in good working order and ready for operation;
5. a group of representatives or delegates
6. a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something;
7. an official document issued by a government and conferring on the recipient the rank of an officer in the armed forces
8. the act of committing a crime
9. a special assignment that is given to a person or group;
1. put into commission; equip for service; of ships

auth_sentence.content: The change was suggested by the Electoral Commission watchdog.
auth_sentence.res_content: The change was suggested by the Electoral Commission watchdog.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The change was suggested by the Electoral Commission watchdog.

auth_sentence.content: He might call for a Royal Commission to investigate.
auth_sentence.res_content: He might call for a Royal Commission to investigate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He might call for a Royal Commission to investigate.

auth_sentence.content: This isn't the view of the European Commission.
auth_sentence.res_content: This isn't the view of the European Commission.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This isn't the view of the European Commission.

stems_affixes.word_buile: miss[v.错过;想念]+ing表形容词→adj.不见的, 缺少的
re不+miss送,放出,派,错过→不送出去→怠慢的
per始终+miss送,放出,派,错过+ive……的→始终放出→纵容的
sub在下面+miss放+ive表形容词→放下面→恭顺的
mission[n.使命,任务;使团,代表团]+ary人→n.传教士

stems_affixes.value_cn: 委员会;委任,委托[书],代办;佣金,手续费
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→共同送出[选出]的人→委员会
e出+miss送,放出+ion表名词→送出去
re再+miss送,放出+ion表名词→再次放过[别人]→宽恕
o出+miss送,放出+ion表名词→放出去→省略
per始终+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→始终放出→允许
trans横+miss送,放出+ion表名词→横着送出去→播送
e出+miss送,放出+ary人→送出去的人
sub下面+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→放下面→屈服

Sentence.sentence: He also urged the Federal Trade Commission to set guidelines for social-networking sites.
minister of social security, quickly commissioned a study to determine the causes of and possible cures for this disturbing stale of affairs.

sentences.en: The commission for the new theatre was given to a well-known architect.
sentences.cn: 建造新剧院之权已委托给一位著名的建筑师。

sentences.en: The commission is made up of five people, including two women.
sentences.cn: 委员会由五人组成, 其中包括两名妇女。

sentences.en: The salesman can get commission on everything he sells.
sentences.cn: 这个售货员能得到所售每件货物的佣金。

sentences.en: He commissioned a statue of his wife.
sentences.cn: 他请人制作他妻子的雕像。

sentences.en: I was commissioned (as a) general in 1944.
My father commissioned a real estate agent to sell our house.
sentences.cn: 我父亲委托了一名房地产经纪人来卖我们的房子。

sentences.en: The city commissioned a monument to commemorate the battle.
sentences.cn: 该市委托人修建了一座纪念碑以纪念这次战役。

jushi.english: The commission is made up of five people, including two women.
jushi.chinese: 委员会由五人组成,其中包括两名妇女。

jushi.english: The salesman can get commission on everything he sells.
